transportAdvice: Chiang Rai's main attractions are spread out, making tuk-tuks, songthaews (shared red trucks), and taxis the most practical options for getting around, as there is no metro or city-wide bus network covering tourist areas. Walking is feasible within the night bazaar and central town area, but a hired vehicle or motorbike rental is recommended for reaching temples and rural sites.
